metadata.title: CVE-2023-4147 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s Netfilterfunctionality when adding a rule with NFTA_RULE_CHAIN_ID. This flaw allowsa local user to crash or escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-5.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-5.5.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-5.5.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-5.5').
linux-aws package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1005.5').
linux-azure package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1004.4').
linux-gcp package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1004.4').
linux-gke package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1005.5').
linux-lowlatency package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-5.5.1').
linux-oracle package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1005.5').
linux-raspi package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1002.2').
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
